etymology.description: Depicts side view of a standing man, highlighting an arm and a leg -> visual representation of a person
etymology.interpretation: The character 人(人) (rén, 'person') effectively uses simple lines to depict the essential form of a human, making it immediately recognizable and intuitive as meaning 'person.'

examples.chinese: 他是个好人(他是個好人)。
每个人都有责任(每個人都有責任)，为社会作出贡献(為社會作出貢獻)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè rén dōu yǒu zérèn, wèi shèhuì zuòchū gòngxiàn.
examples.english: Every person has a responsibility to contribute to society.

examples.chinese: 人在旅途中(人在旅途中)，心灵获得了成长(心靈獲得了成長)。
examples.pinyin: Rén zài lǚtú zhōng, xīnlíng huòdé le chéngzhǎng.
examples.english: People gain growth along their journey.
